review_content: Классический лагер - на кус ничем не отличается от многих других. Для жары и острых блюд.

Tap from automatic machine at Incheon airport, Korea. March 2019.
Strange way to create foam: added at the end after pouring beer...
Decent beer.

4.5%ABV.   Lager. 

Tapped out clear gold.  6°SRM. 

Nose has aromas of malt sweetness, clean lager nose with classic “beery” accents.  Some suggestion of hop aroma which is herbal.

Mouthfeel is clean, light, with a lightly dry finish.  

Palate has flavors of toast, grains, animal crackers, bread crumbs. 

Hop flavors are herbal and barely present.

Finish is clean, malty with a light sweetness.  

Overall, a malt-forward, cleanly made lager with a lightly dry finish.  A good beer by all accounts, not very interesting overall, but technically sound and hits all the right notes for grading.
The foam stability is ok, the body light, The aroma is malty, a bit hoppy. The taste is malty, a bit fruity, hoppy, a bit piney. The hoppy taste is light, but there. Light but ok.

33cl can from a Kuah, Langkawi night shop.
Medium white head.  Clear golden pour.  Not great.  Malty.
From can. Aroma and taste: clean grainy malt, subtle fruity yeast. Well-fernented. Only traces of hop to be tasted. Light body low bitterness. Thirst-quenching. Inoffensive. Cascade hops? Oh come on!

Sampled on draught in Jeju, Korea. This is a wholly inoffensive lager. No very characteristic flavours, but very acceptable in the 34 degree temperatures we are experiencing here in Jeju. Not bad for an industrial lager, but don’t bother to seek it out.
Draught at the mediocre Bingo and Cook in Hong Kong. Well. It was cold. That was the best feature. Tasteless.
Can 330ml in Korea as "Max". Clear golden colour, not much head to talk about. Green apple in the industrial nose. Light-bodied. Sweet malts, green apple, fizzy, no bitterness. Njet.

500ml can
Light amber with solid white head.
Grainy/soapy aroma.
Sweet, thin, soapy, metallic.
Slight bitterness and a hint of malt.
Not sure where the Cascade hops come in?
Ho hum.
Clear darker yellow with small off-white foam ring remaining. Barley in aroma and taste. (Velp 201803)
Bottle. Clear golden color with tiny small white head. Aroma - Malt and yeast. Taste - Lightly bitter, light sweetness, apple bubblegum, malt, hay.
This is simply thin and boring. Even Cascade can't help. There's not much more to say.
Can - Sweet bready malts. Clear pale gold with a small frothy head. Sweet bread and honey like notes with a long finish. A bit too sweet for me.
Pours cloudy golden with low white head. Aroma of bread, light citrus, yuzu, quite floral. Taste is sweet, slightly citrusy and somewhat floral. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.
Классический лагер - на кус ничем не отличается от многих других. Для жары и острых блюд.
Tap from automatic machine at Incheon airport, Korea. March 2019. Strange way to create foam: added at the end after pouring beer...…
4.5%ABV. Lager. Tapped out clear gold. 6°SRM.…
The foam stability is ok, the body light, The aroma is malty, a bit hoppy. The taste is malty, a bit fruity, hoppy, a bit piney. The hoppy taste is light, but there. Light but ok.

33cl can from a Kuah, Langkawi night shop.
Medium white head.  Clear golden pour.  Not great.  Malty.
From can. Aroma and taste: clean grainy malt, subtle fruity yeast. Well-fernented. Only traces of hop to be tasted. Light body low bitterness. Thirst-quenching. Inoffensive. Cascade hops? Oh come on!

Sampled on draught in Jeju, Korea. This is a wholly inoffensive lager. No very characteristic flavours, but very acceptable in the 34 degree temperatures we are experiencing here in Jeju. Not bad for an industrial lager, but don’t bother to seek it out.
Draught at the mediocre Bingo and Cook in Hong Kong. Well. It was cold. That was the best feature. Tasteless.
Can 330ml in Korea as "Max". Clear golden colour, not much head to talk about. Green apple in the industrial nose. Light-bodied. Sweet malts, green apple, fizzy, no bitterness. Njet.
500ml can Light amber with solid white head. Grainy/soapy aroma.…
Clear darker yellow with small off-white foam ring remaining. Barley in aroma and taste. (Velp 201803)
Bottle. Clear golden color with tiny small white head. Aroma - Malt and yeast. Taste - Lightly bitter, light sweetness, apple bubblegum, malt, hay.
This is simply thin and boring. Even Cascade can't help. There's not much more to say.
Can - Sweet bready malts. Clear pale gold with a small frothy head. Sweet bread and honey like notes with a long finish. A bit too sweet for me.
Pours cloudy golden with low white head. Aroma of bread, light citrus, yuzu, quite floral. Taste is sweet, slightly citrusy and somewhat floral. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.

Poured from a can courtesy of Aaron (Thanks bud). Clear and golden in colour, with a frothy white head. Not much in the way of retention, some spotted lacing. Aroma is barley, bread, cereal. Taste is much the same as the aroma. Surprisingly creamy mouthfeel, medium body. Average carbonation. Short, malty finish. Pretty standard stuff, a little boring but not bad
Soapy corn in taste, doesn’t quite live up to the quote on the label of "The climax of rich taste."
500ml can. Pours clear yellow with a soapy white head. Grainy and lemony aroma, and for some reason I can smell cream soda too. Taste is sweet malts and lemons. Didn’t catch the cascade hops.

cereal, toast, citrus, grass, floral lite, dough, leather, leaves, ginger, lite smoke, pale, clear, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, umami, light body, thin feel, lively, astringent,

Bottle 0.5 l, Carrefour, Wrocław, Poland.

Jasnozłote piwo o puszystej ale szybko znikającej pianie i słodowym zapachu. W smaku lekko wodniste i bez wyrazu, słodowe.
Nice color. Light light body and relatively lightly malted. Carbonated like soda. Taste is kinda soapy.

Light lemon, light cardboard, light urinal cake, light grain and straw on the nose - thankfully light! Brilliant, translucent yellow gold with an engineered white foam atop that daubs the glass well. On the palate it exudes a little Cascade citrus to its credit. Drabby, soapy finish with little by way of peak. Light bodied. Not much malt also. Rather bland but didn’t expect much. (35,5cL can, BB 11/03/16, The Good Food & Wine Show, Perth)

355ml can into glass. Nose is sweet sweet corn. Pours pale yellow with soapy white head. A few bubbles. A little zing on the tongue, a hint of lemon and that’s it. Maybe a bit of lingering sherbet. Not horrible.

On tap at NaruOne Korean fried chicken, Sydney. Light in colour, body, flavour, and alcohol. Malty sweetness up front - not in a good way - little bitterness on the finish. Yes, it’s crap, but it’s great for washing down Korean fried chicken.
Can in Hongkong. Malty-sweetish, not too deep. Hints of grain, smooth-sweetish. No bitterness. Boring but not too bad.

500 ml can as “Hite Max” bought at Wellcome Superstore in Sheung Shui.



Clear dull golden yellow colour; Half finger head and soapy white foam which fades in 30 seconds; Small sticky lacing and very slight carbonation;
Light aroma of full malt, with barley grains, faint floral, molasses, dough, hints of lemon and very light grass; Mid to light sweet taste of moderate malt, with fairly light barley grains, strong molasses, light bread, thin floral, very light lemon and shades of grassy hops; Close to light body. Slightly slick palate; Mouth feel is a all-malt macro Pale with moderate maltyness. No adjuncts (good) with light barley grains remains. Strong molasses and quite bready, very low floral and I swear there’s no trace of Cascade hoppiness can be found here. Doh!... Hoppiness is faint floral, hints of lemon and grass notes in nose and taste. Bitterness is macro level, very low for a mostly malty and molasses non-finish; Slightly dry after taste. Very easy to mouth.



Comments: Taste wise, this is at least better than "Hite Beer" because it has no rice or sugar adjuncts. All an all-malt macro Pale, this is fairly hearty and very drinkable, but don’t ask for excitements and the Cascade hops it advertised. It has none!
Légère et rafraîchissante, rien de transcendant, pas désagréable, buvable avec le repas qui va avec...Bouteille 33cl bue dans un resto coréen, Paris, France, le 20/06/2012.
Slabe druzgocaco kiepskie piwo, piana ma problemy aby powstac, jasne zlocista zanadto lekkie, ulagodzone, a system Ice Point sprawia ze jest rozwodnione. Nie polecam tego piwa
From a bottle. Not as bad as I’d expected, but I wasn’t expecting much. Malty (surprise) and smooth with medium carbonation, a bland bog standard mass produced lager.
500ml can from Merry Season, Xiamen. Pours yellow with a dissipating white head. Malt aroma. Thin sweet finish.
Boring beer. Light yellow pour, watery taste, very light and dry body. It has unnatural malt aroma and other flavor is lacking. head disappears very quickly.

355ml can from E-mart in Yeoju, South Korea. Smell ain’t great. A bit of corn husk but mostly nothing- maybe we give it "nutty" to be nice. Looks are not impressive - head just wisps away- no "champagne" bubbles, nothing! BUT the flavor is a suprise - not bad! my favorite of the Korean "Hite" beers - good malt hit but still lite and dry and no bad after taste - in fact tasting pretty clean. It’s my "go-to-Korean" beer!!
Draught. I had this at the Korean Air lounge at Incheon. Sorrid wheat water.

Hite Prime Max
Brewed by The Hite Company
Hoy almorzamos en top cloud que estaba buenisimo

Bottle at Korean BBQ place, Beijing

light moderately full body, slight bitterness, low carbonation, easy drinking, gentle malt character, inoffensive.

500ml bottle at a pretty awesome Korean restaurant in the DC ’burbs. Medium gold pour with a frothy white head. Pretty neutral bready nose. Plenty of cereal sweetness, some apple. Similar flavor. Doesn’t have the tinny, thin flavor I’d expect from a cheap pale lager. Actually pretty drinkable. Light body, active carbonation. Overall, all things considered, this was actually pretty good.

Can sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks kerenmk. As "Max". Pours yellow with a nice head, aroma is sourish, grainy and sweet, flavor is bitter and lagerish with sweetness and metallic notes, light bodied.
Can shared at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks Guy! Clear and golden with white ring. Sweet, catty aroma, sweet and a little pissy taste. Light body, fizzy, sweet finish.

Pours a finger and half of head on a clear golden colored body.
The aroma is a faint candy lemon smell.
The taste is metallic with mild bitterness. Not great.
The texture is quite fizzy, too much with a crisp body.
Don’t smell, taste or feel good. What else is there to say?
At a tasting, thanks kerenmk, clear light gold colour, aroma of cardboard and honey, flavour of wet wool with some fruitiness, light bitterness. Not offensive but pretty mediocre.

Can sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks kerenmk. As "Max". Clear golden. Grainy aroma, slightly corny. Sweetish and grainy flavor with corny notes and a finish with faint bitter notes. Light-bodied. Pretty non-offensive.

330ml Dose. Goldgelbe Farbe, wenig Schaum. Geruch leicht malzig, muffig.
Geschmack wässrig malzig mit leicht unangenehmen Bitternoten.
Classic industrial pale lager... Aromas are cereal, grains, grass and malts. Nothing special but better than most of them.

Can. Pale orange with a loose white head that doesn’t hang around. Odd aroma of lemon, apple, bread, cooked corn, glue. Sweet and grainy with apples, some metal, lemony cleaner. Dryish, slightly astringent finish with very little bitterness. Well into unpleasant territory.

Found this beer in a bottle in a random American burger joint in Seoul. Great refreshing beer for lunch on a very hot and humid day, though it has everything you’d expect (and probably not like) in a pale lager. Meh.

Pale golden coloured body with a hint of a white head. Aroma of rice, corn, pale malt and a big metallic note. Light-bodied; Sharp rice and light malt flavour with a lot of metal, earth and cereal flavours and nothing too pleasing. Aftertaste has a little alcohol, the slightest hint of citrus and more of the funky malt. Overall, a pretty bad offering, but pairs well with spicy food here - however, just drink the soju and pass this one up! I sampled this 33 cL can purchased at GS25 in Myeongdong, Seoul, Korea on 06-April-2012 for 1,200Won.
Well, it’s not offensively bad, but it’s not something I’m going to seek out.  No flavor, crisp, chuggable.  In fact, definitely chug it so it’s over sooner.

Tap (warawara,  suwon)
Bland aroma. Sharp acidic watery palate. Fizzy. Bland. Eugh!

Serving: 330 ml. bottle at Honey Pig Centreville.  A light gold with a small and short lived white head.  The nose has a some bits of grain and grass, but not much else.  More of a premium lager feel  and taste in my opinion.  Slightly fuller bodied than the average pale lager with a little grainy sweetness and a slight nondescript bitterness.  Serviceable if there isn’t anything else.

Can aboard KE 36 from Atlanta to Incheon. Very little aroma, some slight grass, very minor hop. Pale straw, two-finger head, lots of carbonation. Light grassy flavor / sweet, mild mid palate / disappears except for a thin coating of crude graininess. Light body. Label says it contains 100% Aus malt, 86% US hops (Cascade), and 14% German hops. I wouldn’t have noted this, except I was trying to kill time on a 15-hour flight.... and there was no better beer than this. The Cascade was absolutely undetectable.
Ljusgul i färgen, vitt skum som försvinner snabbt. Unken doft med majs och gräs, kemiskt. Smakar tunt majs metalliskt unken malt. Hög kolsyra.

This bottle just says Max but I assume this is the same beer. Its a completely clear golden beer with a fizzing away white head as you pour it, I mean as I pour it. The aroma is foul like grease and corn. The flavor is decent like a premium lager with a malty backbone and a strong bite on the palate. Smelling this, you would never know that it tastes alright. Don’t pour it in a glass and make sure those bottle are ice cold if you want to enjoy this one. The finish is like rotting malt though.

colour is pale yellow, but a fraction darker than the other pale lagers in korea. smell is corny, a tiny hint of alcohol. taste is slightly hoppy, corny-end is astringent from over carbonation. palate is too carbonated. when faced with hite or cass i choose this... not a big difference though. of anything the palate is most irritating with these korean macro lagers as ive never had beers so aggressively and unpleasantly carbonated.
Classic industrial pale lager... Pours yellow with thin white head. Aromas are grains and grass. Light body, lively carbonation. Nothing special.
Can at Victoria St. Not offensive, but boring. Aromas of lemon and leaves. Taste is sweet and short-lived. Thin and watery. Yellow with disappearing head.

Golden coloured beer with medium to light carbonation and a small to non-existing white head. Sweet pilsener malty hinted aroma. Medium palate. Finish is sweet malty grainy and almost unpleasant with a metallic background. Very medium.

Clear golden color with a tall, but short lived, white head.  Nose of corn and sweet grain.  Lots of cereal character, and a sort of adjunct feel, despite the 100% malt claim.  A light grassiness and maybe a hint of yeast.  The flavor is sweet and grassy.  Lots of grain flavor, mild yeast, a hint of bitterness on the finish, and some corn.

(can) Clear rather bright yellowy pale gold with reasonable, but short-lived head. Pleasant aroma: lightly malty, with hints of lemon and grassy hops. Light body, a little watery, with pleasant carbonation. Reasonable malty foretaste then develops some citrus notes and then falls a bit flat with a finish which has notes of bread and a faint metallic tang. Overall, other than the finish, it’s quite acceptable, and a little ahead of most of the other beers on the corner store shelf.
One of the worst beers I’ve ever had. Even bad for a Korean lager. Skunked smell, chemical aftertaste.

Can. I have just mowed the lawn in Texas heat, so this may be biased. Pours a pale gold with a high, fast-dissipating head. No lace. Smells like beer, with a touch of lime Life-Saver. Allowing for the fact that my body is the Gobi Desert right now, it’s pretty tasty; more lime notes, and a touch of bitterness. No skunk or metal, which is a plus. Finishes a little flabby. Good for what it is.

It is a bright sunny Sunday afternoon and I’ve picked up the dog crap and leaves, mown the lawns for the first time this year, I am now sitting in the sun. My wife has even showered the dog in the garden, so summer is almost upon us (it’s 15th March 2009 in Shropshire, England).

In my quest to drink around the world I ordered this beer along with a few others over the interenet from ’Beers of Europe’, didn’t know Korea was in Europe, but hey, they sent the beer.

Brown 330ml twist-top bottle, best before 24th Mar 09, drank 10 days before that date. Poured into a Hoegaarden Grand Cru tulip shaped glass.

Clear golden body, typical lager look, the large bubbles in the head didn’t hang around and soon the white head was a weak collar and a pathetic wisp, these in turn also disappeared before my second gulp.

Sweet lemon grass was the smell I though I detected as I sniffed the bottle before pouring the beer. That aroms faded swifter than the head, so my normal lager/pilsner 3 for smell.

Not unpleasant, but nothing to mark it above anyother lager import around. Starts off sweet in the mouth then turns dry towards the end.

I could imagine drinking this at a hot and sweaty South East Asian beachbar but it isn’t a UK summers drink. Not enough body or seoul (see what I did there? Seoul/Korea) to make it a truely memorable experience. 

I am sure some wag has already suggested the brewery adds an ’S’ to its name, it could then be called the ’Shite Brewery’. This however would be unfair in my opinion, nothing wrong with this lager, however it is just below par and the head loss didn’t help its cause.
Golden clear. Doesnt hold a white head. Bland, chemically laden aroma. Harsh mouthfeel and bite that lasts well after the finish. Heavy malt taste.
I honestly can’t distinguish this beer from the other 10000000 crappy mass produced pale lagers out there. Therefore, it’s cheap and makes for easy drinking.
50cl can, courtesy of Joes. Clear golden color, almost no head and no lacing. Smell malts, rice, yeast. Taste malts, slight sweet hints, grains, yeast. Low carbo, low body.

33 cl can @ Timo A. BBE 10.06.2011.

Pours pale golden colour with minimal head. Aroma of grass, light hops, mild fruity notes and malts. Flavour of grass, malts, some fruits and clove. Quite straightforward, easy to drink

3413

35,5 cl can, BBE 10.06.2011

Very quickly disappearing head. Rather light, somewhat stale and sweet aroma with corn and cardboard. Flavour has corn, sweetish malt, some hops and hints of butter. Typical and harmless pale lager.

0.33l can. Clear as a diamond, pale and golden with a white lager head that disappears quicker than the speed of a relatively fast car I guess. Smells like a pale lager, light dusty-hoppy and mildly malty. Perhaps a hint of some yeasty fruit? All in all quite blend and boring aroma. Really lively carbonation level and the mouthfeel is oily to watery. Not to much flavors  in this one either. Light malty and there is a hint of bitterness in it. It writes on the label that they have putted cascade hops in it, and I guess they can’t really lie on a label. Can they? Anyhow, this is just another boring industrial-beer made to please the crowd of "unknowners"
Thanks to SHIG.  My can just says Max.  Nothing "prime" about it.  Tastes like a light malt liquor.  Smells like a light malt liquor.  Fairly mild flavor.  Not offensive.

5oo ml can in Sulymanyah, Iraq. Pours a clear gold color with a fast to go white head. Aroma is yeast and chemicals. Taste is malt, chemicals and dry dusty straw. Palate is also a bit rough but luckly no bad lingering aftertaste. It is pretty bad.

Bottle in seoul with EY and Kidong. Pale golden lager, almost completely devoid of flavour, you can see why the Koreans make bombs with this stuff. Unclear whether adding whisky makes it better or worse.

Can on Asiana, reads "delicious idea!" Yellow-gold and fizzy looking. Smells a bit bubblegummy. Not at all like cascade hop, as the can says! Harsh and phenolic. Thin and plastic palate. Fizzy. The phenols persist. There is enough dryness to make it ok to drink but it’s not remotely enjoyable.
Can, on an Asiana flight.  Light golden colour.  Quite a tart apple aroma.  The taste is apple juice as well, lightly malty but mostly fruity.  Sweetish, unobjectionable finish.

Rather decent sweet malt nose, with just a touch of floral hops (cascades according to the can). The taste is lightly sweet, and just a touch bitter, with sweet pale malts, some honey and bread dough. Fizzy carbonation and a minerally finish.
07.07. 0,33l can. Pale yellow white head. Aroma is malty with grainy sweetness. Thin body with moderate bitterness.

330ml bottle. Golden amber colour with a pure snow white head that quickly fades away to nothing. Moderate aroma of wet straw. Light and thin in the mouth with very little substance and not a lot going on.
Light yellow colored, little white head. Grassy and lemony aroma. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is more dry with sweet malts and lemon still, round aftertaste.

Champaign color with a head that quickly fizzles into a pond scum residue. Corn and grainy aroma with sweetness to it that is not unpleasant. Easy caramel grain flavor and clean. Perhaps not a work of brew art, but one of the better ones of the lackluster pale lager genre.

Poured a medium golden yellow. 
Nose was cereal grains and dead grass. 
Taste was really grainy, highly carbonated, no residual sweetness, slight hop bitterness, no hop flavor or aroma.

no, no, and definitely not.
Golden hue, grassy, funky aroma - nothing special
tastes the same as it smells.

Worst of the Korean beers we had to day. Bottle thanks to my dad. Pours with a clear golden body and a small white head. Aroma is grassy, skunky, acetaldehyde, corn or rice. Taste is grainy with light hops and adjuncts. Fizzy.

Oh if ever there was a tick.  Golden with a disturbing amount of spongy hazy sediment that I haven’t seen since I had a bottle of palma louca.  Very fizzy and smells like new plastic and modeling glue.  Faint pale malt, maybe some hops?  I’m not picking up much of anything.  Tiny hint of sour in the finish.
[Bought at Utobeer, Borough Market, London and sampled in the train to Stansted.] Surprisingly good with many fresh hopnotes for a pilsner. Go for Seoul!

this is just a worse version of Hite, maybe they take all the dropping of the Hite vats and rebottle them, i dont know.

pours a pale yellow with a thin white head, not much lacing.

smell is faint, grain, and bad malt.

taste is watery, grain, and a funky aftertate.

overall a bad beer, like almost all beers in korea.
From the bottle, lager, blonde, fizzy and watery.  A hint of hops knocking about in there somewhere, and not much else.  It’s fairly S’Hite really ;-)
Pissy golden hue with a very fast dissapating head.  Weak malty skunky nose.  Very thin maltly flavour with a skunked hoppy dry finish.  Sub-standard rubbish.
50cl bottle.  At least all mass produced pale lagers deliver them same sub-standard qualities no matter what their country of origin.  Add it to the pile.

bottle - Pours light gold with a thin white head.  There’s a light aroma with cereal malt and a touch of hops.  The flavor is of a fairly typical pale lager though it’s more substantial than similar Hite offerings.  For a lousy style in general, this beer is actually decent.  It’s light bodied but not really watery and it’s certainly easy drinking.  There’s little else to recommend it, but it might be your best bet of the easy to find beers in Korea.
Clear golden with medium white head. Sweet fruity and malty aroma with caramel notes. Sweet grainy flavor with fruity notes.

Bottled. A light golden beer with a thin disappearing beige head. The aroma is sweet with notes of straw, metal, and brewing cereal - is it rice? The flavor is sweet with medium notes of straw and lighter notes of metal and brewing cereal, leading to a dry bitter finish. The body is thin.
33 cL bottle. Pours clear and pale yellow with a lacing white head. Light acidic corn aroma. Flavour is cornish and light cardboard note. Ends light acidic with a vague bitterness.

Bottle. [thank you, Yespr]
[at Yeprs tuesday tasting]
Well... it’s a new country for me... pours pale yellow-golden with a fizzy white head. Aroma is gross sweetish lemons and even sweeter brew mash. High and lively carbonation. Slightly sweet flavour (much better than aroma). Light dry and metallic finish.
Bottle, thanks to yespr for sharing. Pouyrs a bit pale golden colour with a small white ehad. Aroma and flavour of grains and malt with the flavour also having a light bitterness.

Bottle. [Courtesy of yespr, thanks buddy] Average fizzy white head that mostly lasted. Clear sparkling body with a pale golden colour. Aroma of sweet fruit, malt and grain. Over the palace came light grassy notes with a mix of sweet corn. Light bodied with an average carbonation and light dry texture. Light sweet and bitter flavour. Light grassy bitter finish.

Bottle.  Pours a very deep and lively gold with a nice white head.  First impression of the nose presents hints of sweet corn and sugary malt.  Cardboard cereal malt, kind of like a bowl of old Kellog’s Corn Flakes, greets the taste buds.  A finish of light saccharine rounds out the simplistic pinings of this brew.  Watery mouthfeel.  I guess if I was stuck in South Korea I would drink the heck out of this.  Thankfully, I’m not so I have much more from which to choose.

Koreans really hate beer, my friends there warned me off this one as "it tastes bad" though in fact it was the only beer I had there that tasted of beer rather than mineral water with a twist of beer. Of course it is a palke yellow lager but the 500ml bottle does tell us its "a delicious idea" - "Rich & full bodied  taste beer made from all malt & fine cascade hop" The singular on ther hop is correct but it does actually taste a bit like beer though its very light aroma lets it down.  Best of a bad lot, if your unlucky enough to be stuck in Korea I guess its what I would have to recommend.

Bottle.  Golden and flat with a small head.  Aromas are grain with hints of caramel.  Crisp citrus with metal and herbal notes.  Flavours are sweet grain with soft caramel and biscuit.  Surprisingly decent.
Bottle: Poured a golden clear amber with a foamy carbonated head. Aroma is malt, hops, and grain. Taste is metallic grainy.
From bottle. Ok beer to wet your mouth. I love the slogan on the bottle. "A delicious idea" Yeah an idea.

I’m drinking this from a scotch type glass which apart from a highball is the only glass avaiulable here at the Kuala Lumpur Hilton. got this from Isetan, a Japanese department store. Yeah, lousy Korean swill. Never understood the poor quality of aisan beers compared to each country’s cuisine.

Canned.  Pale yellow, no head. Light tinny apple aroma. Sharp and thin, dominated by 
metal, mashed apples and water. Finishes empty like rusty water. As bad as you’d
come to expect from Korean macrobrews.

A musty and muolder lemon aroma. In the flavor you find little more bitterness than in Hite Beer but the taste is overall very light bodied and rather flat. Would probably taste "better" if you’re on the beach on a sunny day.
